oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Can Stable Isotopes of Carbon and Nitrogen in Hair and Feces Be Used to Predict Dairy Cow Susceptibility to Periparturient Production-related Metabolic Diseases (PRMDs)?
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Roeder, B. L.
Davis, C. A.
Wright, C. K.
Homec, T. J.
Leano, A. D.
Eggett, D. L.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: predictive tool
PRMDs
Periparturient PRMDs
carbon
nitrogen
early intervention
stable isotopes
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The goal of this study was to provide a reliable predictive tool to detect subclinical cows at risk of PRMDs. Prepartum and parturient carbon and nitrogen stable isotopes in feces can identify cows at high risk of PRMDs, and may provide an economical method for early intervention to increase profit margins.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2010; 259
